'''Yamask''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''デスマス''' ''Desumasu'') is a {{type|Ghost}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Cofagrigus}} starting at [[level]] 34.

==Biology==
[[File:Yamask mask.png|left|thumb|200px|The mask of a Yamask]]
Yamask is a shadow-like Pokémon holding a mask that has a face from its time as a [[human]]. It has two shadowy, tendril-like arms and large, red eyes. It also has a small tail-like appendage that holds the mask.

Due to being a human long ago, it has memories of being a human. If someone wears the mask Yamask carries, they will become possessed by the Yamask in question. Sometimes, it looks at this mask and cries, apparently in longing. Yamask is known to wander the ruins of ancient civilizations.
{{left clear}}

==In the anime==
[[File:Yamask anime.png|250px|thumb|left|Yamask in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[James's Yamask]]====
A Yamask appeared before Team Rocket in ''[[BW023|Battling For The Love of Bug-Types!]]'' where [[James]] proceeded to catch it. James had to give Yamask to {{an|Giovanni}} as a sign that they accomplished something in Unova.

====Other====
A Yamask appeared in ''[[BW014|A Night in the Nacrene City Museum!]]'', where it was causing havoc in the [[Nacrene City]] Museum because its mask had been put on display after it accidentally dropped it while sleeping. In the end [[Lenora]], along with {{Ash}}, {{an|Iris}}, {{an|Cilan}} and [[Hawes]] gained an understanding with it and gave its mask back and Yamask left the museum peacefully.

==In the manga==
[[File:BW Agency Yamask Vanillite Solosis.png|thumb|150px|Yamask in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Yamask takes part in [[BW Agency]]'s roster. It trained along with a {{p|Solosis}}, a {{p|Vanillite}}, and [[Gigi]] for the [[Pokémon Musical]] in ''[[PS482|To Make a Musical]]''.

A Yamask appeared in ''[[PS479|The Case of the Missing Pokémon]]'', where it was one of the Pokémon kidnapped by Team Plasma. It was later returned to its Trainer after being found in a stronghold.

A Yamask appeared in a flashback in [[PS536]].

==Trivia==
* Yamask's base {{stat|Speed}} is the same as that of its {{p|Cofagrigus|evolution}}.
* No other Pokémon has the same [[Egg Group]] combination as Yamask and its {{p|Cofagrigus|evolution}}.
* Yamask, along with [[Litwick]], have the lowest base {{stat|Attack}} of all {{type|Ghost}} Pokémon.

===Origin===
Yamask is based on an Egyptian {{wp|Egyptian soul|Ba}} holding a {{wp|death mask}}.

====Name origin====
Yamask may be a combination of 闇 ''yami'' (darkness), や ''ya'' (bad), or ''{{wp|Yama}}'' (lord of the dead in Hindu and Buddhist mythology), and ''mask''.

Desumasu may be a combination of ''death'' and ''mask''. It is also a pun off of ですます体 ''desumasu-tai'', a form of polite Japanese which gets its name from the fact that sentences often end in です ''desu'' or ます ''masu''.
